Package MySystem

Class AccountsHashTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • MySystem.AccountsHashTable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class AccountsHashTable
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class represents hash table that is stored in accounts file. It implements methods for account registration, login and password security.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      AccountsHashTable​(int hashtableSize)
      This constructor creates empty hashtable.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AccountsHashTable

        public AccountsHashTable​(int hashtableSize)
        This constructor creates empty hashtable.
        Parameters:
        hashtableSize - Size of the new hashtable.

    • Method Detail

      • isPasswordStrong

        public boolean isPasswordStrong​(java.lang.String unprotectedPassword)
        Checks if password is secure. Secure password contains at least 8 characters, lowercase letter, uppercase letter, number and a special symbol.
        Parameters:
        unprotectedPassword - String that will be checked for password strength.
        Returns:
        Returns true if password is secure or false if password is weak.

      • register

        public Account register​(java.lang.String username,
                        java.lang.String unprotectedPassword)
        Attempts to register a new account. Registration can fail if username is already in use. Password is secured before it is stored in hashtable.
        Parameters:
        username - New account username.
        unprotectedPassword - New account password.
        Returns:
        Returns registered account if successful, or null if registration failed.

      • login

        public Account login​(java.lang.String username,
                     java.lang.String unprotectedPassword)
        Attempts to login to an existing account. Login can fail if account doesn't exist or password is incorrect.
        Parameters:
        username - Username of existing account.
        unprotectedPassword - Password of existing account.
        Returns:
        Returns login account if it exist and entered password is correct, otherwise it returns null.

      • generateSalt

        public java.lang.String generateSalt()
        Generates random string with 10 characters.
        Returns:
        Returns salt string.

      • generatePepper

        public char generatePepper()
        Generates random character from range of a-z.
        Returns:
        Returns pepper character.
